content.html:
Complete the following questions to practice the skills you have learned in this lesson.

For questions 1-5, determine whether each ordered pair is a solution to the inequality \(y > x − 1\).

1. \((0,1)\)

Correct! Yes

Try again. Work smarter, not harder! Take a moment to think about what you learned in activity 2.10.2. Are you using it the right way?

The correct answer is Yes. You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

2. \((−4,−1)\)

Correct! No

Try again. Work smarter, not harder! Take a moment to think about what you learned in activity 2.1.2. Are you using it the right way?

The correct answer is No. You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

3. \((−4,−1)\)

Correct! Yes

Try again. Why don’t you go back to activity 2.1.2 to test your understanding? Then come back and try this question again.

The correct answer is Yes. You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

4. \((3,0)\)

Correct! No

Try again. Work smarter, not harder! Take a moment to think about what you learned in activity 2.10.2. Are you using it the right way?

The correct answer is No. You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

5. \((−2,−3)\)

Correct! No

Try again. Work smarter, not harder! Take a moment to think about what you learned in activity 2.10.2. Are you using it the right way?

The correct answer is No. You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

21. Which inequality represents the graph?

Multiple choice:

Correct! \((y < 3x − 4\)

Try again. Work smarter, not harder! Take a moment to think about what you learned in activity 2.10.3. Are you using it the right way?

The correct answer is \(y < 3x − 4\). You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?


For questions 22-27, here is a graph of the equation \(2y − x = 1.\)

Correct! Yes

Try again. Work smarter, not harder! Take a moment to think about what you learned in activity 2.10.3. Are you using it the right way?

28. Consider the linear equation \(2y − 3x = 5\). The pair \((-1,1)\) is a solution to the equation. Which of the following is also a solution to the equation?

Multiple choice:

Correct! (3, 7)

Try again. Work smarter, not harder! Take a moment to think about what you learned in activity 2.10.2. Are you using it the right way?

The correct answer is (3, 7). You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

29. Is \((-1,1)\) a solution to the inequality \(2y − 3x < 5\)?

Correct! No

Try again. Work smarter, not harder! Take a moment to think about what you learned in activity 2.10.2. Are you using it the right way?

The correct answer is No. You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

30. Is \((4,1)\) a solution to the inequality \(2y − 3x < 5\)?

Correct! Yes

Try again. Work smarter, not harder! Take a moment to think about what you learned in activity 2.10.3. Are you using it the right way?

31. The boundary line on the graph represents the equation \(5x + 2y = 6\). Which of the following is the inequality that is represented by the graph?

Multiple choice:

Correct! \(5x + 2y < 6\)

Try again. Why don’t you go back to activity 2.10.4 to test your understanding? Then come back and try this question again.

The correct answer is \(5x + 2y < 6\). You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?
